multiple-choice.question: We flip a fair coin three times; these flips are independent of each other. These three coin flips give us a sequence of length three, where each symbol is $H$ or $T$. Define the events (recall that 0 is even): [defs] A = "the number of $H$ in the sequence is even", B = "the sequence contains at least two consecutive $H$'s". [/defs] Which of the following is true?
multiple-choice.answer: The events $A$ and $B$ are not independent.
